Kimi-K2.content:
Yes, there **is** a seahorse emoji: 🦭

Wait — no, that’s the **seal** emoji. 😅

As of now, **there is no official seahorse emoji** in the standard Unicode emoji set. People sometimes use the **🐴** (horse face), **🐟** (fish), or **🌊** (water wave) emojis creatively to represent a seahorse, but none are accurate.

There **have been proposals** to add a seahorse emoji, but it hasn’t been approved yet.

> - The user asked if there's a seahorse emoji, a straightforward inquiry about Unicode symbols.

No, there is no official seahorse emoji in the Unicode Standard (which is what most platforms use for emojis). The closest related emojis are general ones like the fish (🐟) or tropical fish (🐠), but nothing specifically depicts a seahorse. If you're looking for alternatives, you could use text like "🐴" (horse) combined with water-related symbols, but it's not an official emoji.

Qwen3-Coder.content:
Yes, there is a seahorse emoji! 🐴

It was officially added to Unicode in 2017 as part of Unicode 10.0. The seahorse emoji depicts a stylized seahorse in a curved, upright position, typically shown in a golden or yellow color.

You can use it in messages, social media posts, or anywhere that supports emoji input. It's often used to represent marine life, ocean themes, or simply as a cute decorative element.

This is a common point of confusion and a frequent request. While there are emojis for everything from a lobster (🦞) to a mosquito (🦟), the seahorse has not yet been approved by the Unicode Consortium.

People often use these as substitutes:
*   **🐠** or **🐟** (Tropical Fish) - For general small sea life.
*   **🐎** (Horse) - For the "horse" part of the name.
*   **🦄** (Unicorn) - For something equally magical and mythical-looking.

The good news is that new emojis are proposed every year. A seahorse emoji is a strong candidate for a future release, so keep an eye out!

> 
### No Standard Seahorse Emoji Exists, Spurring 'Mandela Effect' Debate

Contrary to popular belief, there is no official seahorse emoji in the Unicode standard, the system that ensures emojis appear consistently across different devices. [[1]](https://www.wikihow.com/Seahorse-Emoji) As of April 2025, the seahorse has not been approved as a standard emoji, a fact that has led to widespread online discussion and confusion. [[1]](https://www.wikihow.com/Seahorse-Emoji)

Many people have vivid memories of a seahorse emoji, often described as yellow or blue and facing left. [[1]](https://www.wikihow.com/Seahorse-Emoji)[[2]](https://thetab.com/2024/10/10/everyone-is-convinced-there-used-to-be-a-seahorse-emoji-lets-debunk-whether-it-ever-existed) This collective misremembering is widely cited as an example of the "Mandela Effect," a phenomenon where a large group of people recall something that never happened. [[1]](https://www.wikihow.com/Seahorse-Emoji)[[3]](https://www.timesnownews.com/world/us/us-buzz/seahorse-emoji-a-case-of-mandela-effect-exploring-controversy-sweeping-iphone-fanatics-article-114160179) The memory of a seahorse emoji might be confused with the existing tropical fish emoji, which has a similar color scheme and orientation. [[2]](https://thetab.com/2024/10/10/everyone-is-convinced-there-used-to-be-a-seahorse-emoji-lets-debunk-whether-it-ever-existed)

While a standard seahorse emoji is not available on platforms like Apple and Android, some services offer their own custom versions. [[1]](https://www.wikihow.com/Seahorse-Emoji) For instance, multiple seahorse emojis can be found and used on the communication platform Slack. [[1]](https://www.wikihow.com/Seahorse-Emoji) Additionally, users of Apple devices with iOS 18.2 or later can create their own custom seahorse emoji using the "Genmoji" feature. [[1]](https://www.wikihow.com/Seahorse-Emoji)

The absence of an official seahorse emoji has prompted requests and proposals for its inclusion in the Unicode standard. [[2]](https://thetab.com/2024/10/10/everyone-is-convinced-there-used-to-be-a-seahorse-emoji-lets-debunk-whether-it-ever-existed)[[4]](https://github.com/Crissov/unicode-proposals/issues/176) Petitions have been created, and discussions on platforms like Apple's support forums highlight user demand for the marine creature to be represented in the official emoji set. [[2]](https://thetab.com/2024/10/10/everyone-is-convinced-there-used-to-be-a-seahorse-emoji-lets-debunk-whether-it-ever-existed)

As an alternative, some users have resorted to creative combinations of existing emojis to represent a seahorse, such as pairing the wave emoji (🌊) with the horse emoji (🐎 or 🐴). [[1]](https://www.wikihow.com/Seahorse-Emoji)
